questions.text: a) Pharmacist appearance is clean, neat and tidy.
b) Wears formal office wear with closed toe shoes.
c) Wears clean white coat and pharmacist badge.

pages.title: 2. Pharmacy or Nutrition Counter or Signage and Display

questions.text: a) Valid pharmacist Poison License A for the premise displayed.
b) Valid pharmacist Annual Retention Certificate is displayed.
c) Pharmacist on-duty name and time signage displayed.
d) Pharmacist Signage displayed as appropriately:
options: i. Dispensing of Group Poison B
iii. Pharmacist Out For Break(Health Consultation A4 Poster)

questions.text: e) Poison record books displayed neatly.
f) Poison dispensing envelopes and stickers displayed neatly.
g) Meditag decoder displayed.
h) No display of unapproved supplier countertop or leaflets or brochures.
a) Kept clean at all times.
b) All poisons must be kept inside cabinets under lock and key.
c) Poison cabinet key must be kept with the pharmacist and not in the cabinet drawers.
d) Must be locked when pharmacist out for break or off-duty and no medication supplied without the presence of a licensed pharmacist for the premise in store.
e) Poison arranged neatly according to category
f) Complete price card & clearly displayed for each poison.
g) Complete price tags on individual poison.
h) All near-expired poisons or expired poisons.
options: i. Separated from other poisons and kept inside a box in a cabinet under lock and key
